breakthroughPP.mechanics

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • breakthroughPP.mechanics.Engine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, IOTransfer, Setting
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NetEngine

    public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
implements Setting, Storable, IOTransfer
    This class can be executed. It parses the input form the command line and defines the game, consequently. Two interactive players are locally initialised. In case of a local game, the game between both players is also managed. This includes the mechanics of initialising both players as well as requesting and confirming moves from one and updating the other player. It privids also the opportunity to save which is activated by calling init() of this instance or setEnableStore(true) command line options are: -d Shows the board of the engine and additional information about the state of the game, default is off -s Sets the dimensions of the board, default 26 26 -l Load a game, with stored board dimensions and used player types. Additional -s option has no effect. -c In case your are on a linux system you can make the terminal colorful, everywhere else you get an default output, default is off. Georg-August University Goettingen APP breakthroughPP SoSe 2016 Gr CodeSalat
    Author:
    Jan-Philipp Burchert loading a previous game in function init(), Haseeb Sabar Anar

        public void setMoveDelay(int milliseconds)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the commited delay time is negative as a time which is added to the duration of Player.request(), Player.confirm(Status boardStatus),Player.update(Move opponentMove, Status boardStatus) must not be negative

      • setOptions

        protected void setOptions(java.lang.String[] args)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Function which takes the command line input and processes it. This method goes through the array of strings an compares them to strings representing the different options for the game. If a match is found, the default parameters for the game are altered. It is necessary to run this function before running init(). If there are no arguments the default parameters remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line input arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one or more command line inputs do not match to the definitions of the inputs of the game

      • readNumber

        protected int readNumber(java.lang.String[] args,
             int index)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The function checks if it is possible to return an integer of the element specified by its index in the array args starting with 0. If it ist possible the integer is returned.
        Parameters:
        args - Array of input arguments
        index - Index of the string in args which should be transformed into a number
        Returns:
        number which is at position index in args
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if args is to smaller than the index or if the conversion to int from args[index] has failed

      • init

        public boolean init()
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                    java.lang.Exception,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Initialisation of the game with possibly changed default parameters (see setOptions(java.lang.String[])). This function either initiates a game according to default or set parameters or loads a previous game with its parameters (see Storable). In the first case two interactive players are produced. They share a common text input and a text ouput instance respectively.
        Returns:
        true if the executable function of this class should manage the game Important maybe for extensions of this class.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a player initalisation throws such an exception (see Player)
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if setOptions(String[] args) has not been called and the user's commands have not been considered
        VisualisationException - if the text output of the internal board throws one (see Showable.update()
        java.lang.Exception - if something else fails during initialisation

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This function administrates the game by alternatingly calling the cycle of Player.request() and Player.confirm(Status boardStatus) on one player and Player.update(Move opponentMove, Status boardStatus) on the other. The first request is called on the red player. To call this function init() needs to be called first. According to the internal board also the decision of victory or defeat is reached.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game has not been initialised yet

      • moveCycle

        private Status moveCycle(Player player,
               Player opponent)
        This function calls Player.request() and after putting the move onto the internal board and receiving the status Player.confirm(Status boardStatus) on the player and Player.update(Move opponentMove, Status boardStatus) on the opponent
        Parameters:
        player - the player upon whom request and confirm is called
        opponent - the player receiving the move of the player and the resulting status
        Returns:
        the status after the entire move cycle

        Method which produces an ouput only if the debug switch is set (option -d). This works if setOptions(String[] args) has already been called
        Parameters:
        content - Content being shown in the terminal
